citation.article-title: Aquabacter spiritensis, gen. nov., sp. nov., an aerobic, gasvacuolate aquatic bacterium

p.s: Aquabacter (Aq.ua.bac'ter. L. n. aqua, water; M.L. masc. bacter equivalent of Gr. neut. n. bacterion, a rod; M.L. masc. n. Aquabacter, a water rod)
Cells are straight rods, 0.5-1.0 by 1.5-3 μm.
May be motile under certain specified conditions.
Gas vacuoles arranged at random within the cells.
Will grow in chemically defined medium using ammonium as a nitrogen source.

Growth occurs at 25 to 37°C but not at 20 or at 40°C The mol% G + C of the DNA is 67% (one strain). Aquabacter belongs to the Azorhizobium rRNA branch within rRNA superfamily VI of the Proteobacteria.
At the suprageneric level, Aquabacter is related to Azorhizobium and Xanthobacter.
The type species is Aquabacter spiritensis sp. nov.
